para: WS GRAM usability has improved considerably in GT4!

listitem.para:
Improved service performance:
Job Concurrency. The maximum number of jobs a gram service can manage at one time.
Job Throughput. The rate at which jobs can be processed (e.g. x /bin/date jobs per minute).
Job Latency. The rate at which a single operation to the GRAM service can be processes.
Details of performance testing can be found here.

listitem.simpara: Fault Tolerance. The ability for the GRAM service to recover after a container or host crash. Recovery includes the continued processing and monitoring of all jobs managed by the GRAM service at the time of the crash. The &shortversion; GRAM architecture was simplified (from GT3) which is the main reason that fault tolerance has improved.
